data.text:
MR. GEORGE ENGLUND AND MRS. ENGLUND (CLORIS LEACHMAN)

The famed Hollywood couple, George H. Englund and Cloris Leachman, sign personal checks separately as "George H. Englund" and "Mrs. George Englund" in blue ink. Very special combination!

Checks combination. 1) Check signed: "George H. Englund" by George H. Englund in blue ink. 6x2¾ personal check signed April 22, 1955. For the amount of $3.00 to the Van Vleck Deposit Company. Edges frayed. Authorization punctures throughout. Ink stamps on verso. Slightly toned. Otherwise, fine condition. 2) Check signed: "Mrs. George Englund" by Cloris Leachman in blue ink. 6x2¾ personal check signed December 18, 1972. For the amount of $10.00 to the Beverly Hills Municipal Court. Slightly toned. Light surface creases. Ink stamps on verso. Authorization punctures throughout. Otherwise, fine condition. GEORGE H. ENGLUND (1926-2017), is a TV and film producer, director, editor and screenwriter. He has a total of 12 producing credits between 1963 and 1988 and eight directing credits between 1963 and 1984. Englund's first effort as a director, The Ugly American (1963), earned him a Golden Globe nomination. His first wife was actress Cloris Leachman (1953-1978). CLORIS LEACHMAN (1926-2021) has consistently demonstrated her versatility in films and on television since the 1950s. Her films include Kiss Me Deadly (1955), Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969), The Last Picture Show (1971) for which she won an Oscar for Best Supporting Actress, Young Frankenstein (1974) and Deadly Intentions (1985). On TV Leachman has appeared in Lassie, The Mary Tyler Moore Show and her own series Phyllis. She has won three Emmy Awards and continues to make TV, stage and film appearances, including a turn as Granny in the film version of The Beverly Hillbillies (1993).

This website image may contain our company watermark. The actual item does not contain this watermark
